text: Click here to start a new application.
Click here to start the admissions process.
Before being sent the link to the International Student Application, you must complete all of the steps below:

Send an Introductory Email to the Director of Admissions, Justin Kendall, explaining your educational background, academic goals, and financial resources available to pay for your education. Send the email to admissions@barclaycollege.edu.
Complete the International Student Declaration of Finance and Foreign Student Certification of Finance forms (they will be emailed to you after you submit your introductory email).
Request official transcripts from all schools you have attended.
Request copy of TOEFL iBT (minimum score of 80) or IELTS (minimum Band Score of 6.5) scores.
Provide a copy of your current passport.
Provide a copy of your current I-20 (if applicable).
Prepare the non-refundable $75 (USD) Application Fee that will be required when submitting your application.
Once these items have been received, you will be sent a link to the International Student Application.

Barclay College admits students based on academic record and abilities, Christian commitment, and agreement with the established purposes of the college. Admission and attendance at Barclay College is a privilege, not a right of any student. Barclay College does not discriminate based on sex, race, color, national/ethnic origin, age, or physical disability in administrating its programs or policies. Regular Admission to the college will be granted to students who pass the college's admissions standards, have completed high school, have cumulative high school or college grade point averages of 2.3 or better, and who have scores of at least 500 on the SAT Writing section or 18 on the ACT English section.

Students who do not pass the requirements for regular admission may be permitted to attend the college under conditional or probationary admission standards. These may include a limit on semester hours, required study halls, remedial courses, or additional requirements designed to help the student transition to college and succeed.

Nontraditional and second-career students who do not meet normal admission requirements may receive special admission to college programs. Such students, and their programs, are subject to annual review by the college until they have met minimum admission standards.

Barclay College welcomes transfer students. Those desiring to transfer to Barclay must complete an application for admission and should furnish a transcript of all high school and college work previously taken for credit. Normally, transfer students are accepted only with evidence of an honorable withdrawal.
In the acceptance of transfer credits the college will be guided by the prescribed policy of the Association for Biblical Higher Education (ABHE).

Credits are accepted for relevant subjects from accredited members of ABHE and from other schools accredited by recognized institutional and professional agencies on the basis of the equivalency for work of a C grade or higher. Credits from nonaccredited, nonmember schools are accepted only on the basis of sound validation. Final validation of transcripts of transfer students from nonaccredited schools will be withheld until satisfactory completion of approximately 30 semester hours at Barclay College.
Students who have previously attended Barclay College and have not enrolled for at least one semester must reapply for acceptance. If you have trouble completing your application,

Barclay College admits students based on academic record and abilities, Christian commitment, and agreement with the established purposes of the college. Admission and attendance at Barclay College is a privilege, not a right of any student. Barclay College does not discriminate based on sex, race, color, national/ethnic origin, age, or physical disability in administrating its programs or policies. Regular Admission to the Graduate Program will be granted to students who pass the admissions standards, have completed high school and a bachelor's degree, and have cumulative college GPA or 2.5 or better.

Students who do not pass the requirements for regular admission may be permitted to attend the Graduate School college under conditional or probationary admission standards. These may include a limit on semester hours, required GPA goals, remedial courses, or additional requirements designed to help the student transition to college and succeed.
The Barclay College Graduate Program accepts student applications from many countries and cultures. Students outside the United States wishing to study online through Barclay College should
explaining their academic interests, educational background and financial resources.

Regular Admission to the college will be granted to students meeting the college's admissions standards, have completed a bachelor's degree, have a cumulative college grade point averages of 2.5 or better, and who have TOEFL scores of at least 80 on the iBT. International students are required to demonstrate proof of ability to finance their college education prior to acceptance being granted.

Barclay College welcomes transfer students. Those desiring to transfer classes into the Graduate Program must complete an application for admission and should furnish a transcript including the classes they wish to transfer into the program along with transcripts of all college work previously taken for credit.
In the acceptance of transfer credits the college will be guided by the prescribed policy of the Association for Biblical Higher Education (ABHE).

Credits are accepted for relevant subjects from accredited members of ABHE and from other schools accredited by recognized institutional and professional agencies on the basis of the equivalency for work of a B grade or higher. A maximum of three courses can be transferred into the Barclay College Graduate Program.
Students who have previously attended the Barclay College Graduate Program and have not enrolled for at least one year must reapply for acceptance. If you have trouble completing your application,
